title: Pork Roasted in Honey, Soy Sauce & Sherry
ingredients: 3 pound boned half leg of pork
instructions: Remove the rind from the pork but leave on as much fat as possible.  Lay the meat out flat and cut into 4 equal strips.  Slash diagonally 3 to 4 times.  Season the pork with pepper.

Make the marinade by mixing 6 tablespoons of the honey with the remaining ingredients in a shallow container.  Place the meat in the marinade, cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator overnight.
Preheat the oven to 375° F.  Remove the meat from the marinade.
Use a tray with about 1-inch of water above which you have placed a rack.  Place the meat on the rack and roast it for 30 minutes.

Remove each piece of meat, one by one, and dip them into the marinade and return them to the oven again.  Roast for another 15 minutes.  Repeat the process two more times of removing and dipping each piece in the marinade and returning them to the oven for roasting 15 minutes, except the last time you return the meat to the oven let it roast only 10 minutes.  When you remove the meat from the oven the last time immediately brush it with the remaining honey.
Source:  Harrods Cookery Book by Marilyn Aslani, Arbor House, New York, © 1985 by Marilyn Aslani and the National Magazine Co. Ltd.
